Posted By: Totema (9/25/2012 6:27:01 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I've done some research on the subject of elk versus bear duels and there seems to be a consensus that bears have more raw power, but elks have a tad bit more stamina. Meaning that if your standard bear is a 2/2, your elk ought to be a 2/3 (but perhaps with Defender as they won't generally initiate the fight). Nothing I've read, however, has led me to believe that an elk could ever be a 6/7. Except for in Ravnica, of course.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: If you recall from the original Ravnica, you'll remember that there's literally no animal life left on the plane. Everything that isn't someone's pet, entertainment, or lunch, has to be a gigantic monstrosity to have survived the slow overpopulation of the planet, like the wurms, the dragons, or hopefully the Lamasu. the [hunted](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hunted) cycle of the original Ravnica showcases this nature-dying-out theme well. For an Elk, of all things, to be alive in Ravnica today it had better be some kind of monstrosity to survive.

add the following:

HANG. ON. Let's review here, ok?  
  
Lorwyn/Shadowmoor Block: Correct me if I'm wrong but I think all the 'Demigods' were 5/5, right? They'd have been Mythic if such had exited. This beats most of them, too.   
  
Alara Block: Alright, so there were a good number of creatures that had 7 or more power. Most of those were Gold Legendary Creatures, Rare or Mythic. This is a Mono Green Common Elk.  
  
Zendikar Block: FINE, Eldrazi don't even care about how tiny this thing is. NON-ELDRAZI creatures, how many does this kill? Doesn't it beat [Wrexial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrexial)? AL-MOST! and too close for comfort! ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
